modules.description: This module manages fontmaps for rendering text with Cairo and Pango, providing functions to create, configure, and retrieve fontmaps. It supports operations like setting and getting the default fontmap per thread, specifying Cairo font backend types, and adjusting resolution scaling for font sizing. Concrete use cases include initializing a fontmap for PDF rendering with a specific Cairo font backend or adjusting font resolution for high-DPI displays.

This module bridges Pango's text layout capabilities with Cairo's rendering, allowing creation and manipulation of Pango contexts and layouts that reflect Cairo's current state. It supports rendering complex text layouts, converting text into Cairo paths, and drawing visual feedback such as error underlines, all while managing fontmaps for precise control over font rendering across different surfaces. You can use it to render styled text in a GUI, convert text into vector paths for scalable graphics, or adjust font resolution for crisp display on high-DPI screens. Specific operations include updating a Pango layout from a Cairo context, drawing glyphs with custom styling, and configuring fontmaps for specific Cairo backends like PDF or image surfaces.
